title: Great!
comment: If you prefer to be read by paragraph this is the TTS option for you.  But if you are okay with being read by sentence then I'd recommend the TTS+.  You can also change the TTS+ pronunciations which I have found very helpful.  No matter which you choose, they both work great!

Fantastic

title: Just needs a substitute index
comment: This works great and faithfully uses the TTS on my Note 3. The only thing that would make it better is if you could create a per-book word list to substitute words for better phonetic versions. Many proper names are butchered by TTS. I would like it if we could change a name like "Ty" to read as if it were "Tie" instead of "Tea" like it tries to do. If you could create a dictionary of replacements, it might fix an entire book's mispronounciation.

Thank you so much!

title: Fantastic!
comment: This is really great! It uses whatever TTS engine you have installed and active on your Android. I'm using it with Ivona voices and find the pronunciation really good. With the speech capability, I can read a book in the traditional way and if I need to stop reading in order to drive or exercise, I can continue to read the story by listening to it being read to me. Extremely useful!

title: Try also TTS+ Plugin for FBReader
comment: Implements Bluetooth controls (play/pause/resume, next/previous) and has more useful settings and features. Also free. Search Play Store for "FBReader TTS+ Plugin". Definitely use with higher quality voices like IVONA or at least SVOX.

title: Higher pitch needed

title: Super Useful feature
comment: Use with IVONA voices for great results. Not like audio books, but still very usable.  I upgraded to CM9 on HP Touchpad and the wake lock stopped working. Fixed! Five stars.

title: R.H
comment: The TTS still has much to improve on still. The voice is painful to listen to even with earphones.

title: Poor

title: It's a cute TTS App
comment: To me, TTS is not a novel concept. A recent update to the fbreader app itself has fixed a bug I had commented on. The app no longer forgets its plug-in. I like this engine, even though I don't use it often. And my own preferences are for the more lightweight speech engines, even though this plug-in will probably work with most of the back-ends. Nice work.

title: Decent TTS, but..
comment: This really needs to somehow be adapted to run as a service because it stops speaking as soon as the screen timeout occurs. Keeping the screen on permanently whilst on battery is not a solution, so this is really only useful when the device is plugged into a power source and that severely limits it for me. I would love to have books read to me whilst out and about but this currently can't do so. The bug with it only appearing in the FBReader menu until it's used for the first time is a pain too but it's not known whether that's a bug in this plugin or the reader itself.     Add a service to it to handle the actual TTS itself and some options to alter speed and pitch and this would be a solid 5 stars. For now it does perform admirably when my phone is on charge.

title: Works great
comment: Works great with FB Reader on my Galaxy S i9000 although I have only used it briefly, will report back after I give it a full workout

title: An okay start.
comment: Works but has rough edges: 1) Inter-sentence pausing is too long and not configurable. 2) Complains that french language is not available before starting to read my english ebook. 3) Can add awkward pauses in the middle of really long sentences. 4) HUGE pauses (almost a full minute) when screen turns off and locks.
A really good start. Simple plug-n-go operation. Would be nice to get access to speed and voice type but it is pretty clear once you get used to it.
